intro: Agonandra obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed agonandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Agonandra obtusifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
